intro: Swida bretschneideri var. crispa, commonly known as the crinkled swida, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive, crinkled leaves that give it a unique appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by red berries in the fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
